title: Microstructural and Electroactivity Evaluation of PANI and PANI/Ag Composite
content: The properties of polyaniline (PANI) have been used for the fabrication of electrochemical devices, and PANIâ€™s conductivity and morphology are two of the main traits that favor the aforementioned use. In addition, the fabrication of a considerable number of composites using PANI is found in the literature nowadays. Among other composites, PANI/metal composites are recognized for their useful electrochemical properties and versatility regarding the preparation of combined materials. Moreover, silver (Ag) nanoparticles were considered as a promising nanocomponent due to their compatibility in biological interactions with numerous biomolecules [1]. The intrinsic efficiency of these metallic particles can be further improved by incorporating active organic compounds over the surface of these nanomaterials [2].
